meanings.sent1: The new shopping mall will suburbanize the downtown area.
meanings.sent2: Many families choose to suburbanize for a quieter lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would suburbanize, but now I love the peace and quiet.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality seemed to suburbanize the gloomy office environment.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers and neatly trimmed lawns suburbanize the neighborhood beautifully.

meanings.sent1: The city council decided to suburbanize the industrial zone.
meanings.sent2: The old farm was suburbanized into a residential community.
meanings.sent3: It's like a magic spell - suburbanize! Poof, and it's a suburb!
meanings.sent4: The once bustling city street was suburbanized into a peaceful cul-de-sac.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew worked tirelessly to suburbanize the open fields into housing developments.

meanings.sent1: The real estate company plans to suburbanize the outskirts of town.
meanings.sent2: The government initiative aims to suburbanize rural areas for urban expansion.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken suburbanize? To get to the other side of the city!
meanings.sent4: The company's vision is to suburbanize the empty land into thriving communities.
meanings.sent5: The architect's design will suburbanize the empty lots into vibrant neighborhoods.
